channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: C/w gully is frequently blocked/surcharged after the slightest rain causing significant standing water in vicinity of both church and much used point of pedestrian road crossing (facilitated by kerbed central refuge) - gey SubTek on the job to do a hard hit once and for all as all pervious efforts have been ineffective/poor/only temporary releases - SubTek will do a proper job and sort the problem!, 1st December
item.description:
Westbound direction between mini-roundabouts, at end of buildout 'lobe' (with PGR?).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Saint James Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road cracking due to subsidence, 1st December
item.description:
The tree is oversized and apparently was planted without a root barrier (which other tree have in the road - this was a replacement tree for one which died shortly after planting). There has also been a bund dug in the open space to avoid flooding and these two issues would appear to have caused the ground under the road to move and create the crack. The Parish council are removing the tree but asked me to report this to you as the road cracking is considered to be subsidence as there are several other examples around the estate. Bloor Homes have confirmed that under the S38 agreement, all the estate roads are now the responsibility of Gloucestershire County Council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hurricane Drive, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 1st December
item.description:
Double yellow lines need painting. Requesting cones to stop parking on the day of line painting.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: A pothole in pavement problem, 1st December
item.description:
The footpath along the exit from the garage site, is also in need of repair. Nasty pothole along the route that pedestrians use.

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 1st December
item.description:
This is the sign by the filling station just along from the entry to the Curry's / Smiths Toys site. It's definitely looking sad and neglected. Can it be given a make over before the winter storms hit and really kill it off?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 1st December
item.description:
Dear Gloucestershire Council, I was driving on the Elkstone Road recently within the speed limit when I drove into a large pothole that damaged two tyres on the car.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole stretch of road has had cats eyes removed leaving gaping holes, 1st December
item.description:
As part of cycle lane works on B4063, Whole stretch of road has had cats eyes removed leaving gaping holes. I am having to swerve every morning to miss them, therefore having multiple near head on collisions. The road is now so thin, that you have hardly any space to miss oncoming traffic. Road is next to Brickhampton Golf Course entrance all the way down to traffic lights at Meteor Business Park
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victory Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

Customer states

item.title: Overgrown hedge and verge on junction, 1st December
item.description:
The entrance of ‘Oakfields’ is overgrown making pulling out onto ‘Malleson Road’ much harder amd more dangerous. Cars drive along Malleson rd very quickly given it is still a 50 until our junction. As well as general maintenance to the verge, a mirror opposite the junction could be beneficial.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
The signpost showing priority has been damaged. It is at the road calming island outside Naunton Schoo, on the corner of Naunton Way. The post has been bent a bit and the sign has fallen to ground.

item.title: Unlit caravan not moved since July, 30th November
item.description:
There is a caravan parked opposite Reeves Field in Charlton Park Drive. It is unlit and a danger at night as that section of road is very dark. I has not moved since July and the number plate that was on it has been removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, King William Drive, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Unable to pass along pavement safely, 30th November
item.description:
The hedge alongside 20 Cowslip Meadow is now dangerously overhanging the pavement by at least 2.5 feet. I cannot get a pushchair down the pavement safely. This has been reported before but was deemed safe! A lady on her mobility scooter had to reverse back as she could not negotiate it. How can this be deemed safe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keepers Mill, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Brockworth Bridleway 60 - path muddy beyond resurfacing, 30th November
item.description:
The recent repair works to get rid of the muddy section of the Brockworth bridleway 60 has improved the path way, and resolved much of the problems, however, muddy sections, continue further along the path, it requested that you extend the works at the very least to the junction with the unadopted pathway leading to Bamel Way on the Gloucester business Park. Without this work, the path is still inconvenient to users of route during all seasons of the year. Given its urban location of this route, there is a need to take greater consideration of the needs of all users, including those who might try to use the route using motorised scooters and the like. In determining your prioritisation of this, I would draw your attention to the fact that this is a critical piece of infrastructure to provide access to community services based on the business Park due to your inability to adopt a roots via golf course road to the business Park from the Spinners Road ecetera development at the rear of Invista

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Spinners Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 30th November
item.description:
PERM Could you raise a perm repair enquiry for the above job number at SOUTHAM LANE, sunken drain , made safe with traffic lights...Drain has dropped considerably by a few inches and is worried someone could get hurt USRN 40102099 Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 30th November
item.description:
Customer's 3 year old daughter has fallen off her balance bike as she was crossing the road. Her daughters went to A&E and her tooth has gone through her lip and she is very shaken up. Customer has mentioned claiming but has stressed that she does not want this happening again as this is dangerous and her daughter was lucky as it could of been worse.
Report on FixMyStreet
